com.lehman.ic9.db

Class jdbc

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lehman.ic9.db.jdbc

  • public class jdbc
extends java.lang.Object
    Jdbc object implements generic Java JDBC functionality. This object can be extended to implement more specific connectors or simply be used as is to manage a database connection.
    Author:
    Austin Lehman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      jdbc(ic9engine Eng, java.lang.String Driver, java.lang.String Url, java.lang.String UserName, java.lang.String Password)
      Object constructor takes connection information and creates a new JDBC object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • jdbc

        public jdbc(ic9engine Eng,
            java.lang.String Driver,
            java.lang.String Url,
            java.lang.String UserName,
            java.lang.String Password)
        Object constructor takes connection information and creates a new JDBC object.
        Parameters:
        Eng - is a ic9engine instance.
        Driver - is a String with the JDBC driver.
        Url - is a String with the database url to connect to.
        UserName - is a String with the user name to connect with.
        Password - is a String with the password to connect with.

      • connected

        public boolean connected()
        Checks to see if the connection is connected. This method doesn't actually verify the connection is valid.
        Returns:
        A boolean with true for connected and false for not.

      • setDriver

        public void setDriver(java.lang.String Driver)
        Sets the connection driver String. This only has an effect if the connection hasn't been opened.
        Parameters:
        Driver - is a String with the connection driver.

        public void setUserName(java.lang.String UserName)

        UserName - is a String with the connection user name.

      • selectQueryRaw

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> selectQueryRaw(java.lang.String QueryString)
                                                                throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                                       javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                       ic9exception
        Makes a SELECT query with the provided query string. Note this method is not recommended and is unsafe. In most cases you should use selectQuery method instead as it does security checks on the provided data through the prepared statement functionality.
        Parameters:
        QueryString - is a String with the query.
        Returns:
        A Javascript list of objects. Each object represents a row of data and can be accessed by number index or by column name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - Exception
        javax.script.ScriptException - Exception
        ic9exception - Exception

      • selectQuery

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> selectQuery(java.lang.String QueryString,
                                                                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> ParamsList)
                                                             throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                                                                    javax.script.ScriptException,
                                                                    ic9exception
        Makes a SELECT query with the provided query string and parameter list. This is implemented with the Java JDBC prepared statement functionality.
        Parameters:
        QueryString - is a String with the query to execute.
        ParamsList - is a Javascript list of parameters to use in the prepared statement query.
        Returns:
        A Javascript list of objects. Each object represents a row of data and can be accessed by number index or by column name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - Exception
        javax.script.ScriptException - Exception
        ic9exception - Exception

      • updateQuery

        public void updateQuery(java.lang.String QueryString,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> ParamsList)
                 throws java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                        javax.script.ScriptException,
                        ic9exception
        Makes an UPDATE query with the provided query string and parameter list. This method uses the Java JDBC prepared statement functionality.
        Parameters:
        QueryString - is a String with the query to execute.
        ParamsList - is a Javascript list of parameters to use in the prepared statement query.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - Exception
        javax.script.ScriptException - Exception
        ic9exception - Exception

      • updateQueryRaw

        public void updateQueryRaw(java.lang.String QueryString)
                    throws ic9exception
        Makes an UPDATE query with the provided query string. This method is not secure and it's recommended in most cases to use updateQuery method instead.
        Parameters:
        QueryString - is a String with the query to execute.
        Throws:
        ic9exception - Exception
